abstracts.cdata!:
The solid waste management project
            financed by the World Bank and implemented in the Liepaja
            region is a part of the plan aiming at reducing the number
            of currently countless dumps, both legal and illegal, to
            10-12 technologically well-provided regional solid waste
            management sites. So far, there have been around 500 dumps
            in Latvia. Skede is situated in a beautiful and highly
            favored location about one kilometer away from the Baltic
            Sea and near Lake Tosmare, which stretches in the area of
            natural reserve, rich in rare plants. Waste has been
            discharged here since 1960. A facility for collection of
            biogas will be built at the Grobina landfill. At Skede, a
            gas collection station will operate where gas generated by
            rotting waste through a specially built collection system
            will be channeled to a generator producing electricity.
            Under the Kyoto protocol, carbon quotas can be traded, and
            as Latvia does not use its quota in full, it can sell a part
            to another country via the prototype carbon fund.
